This was done on purpose, with the idea of having multiple "layers" of a service being executed on the same thread, avoiding context switches. Unfortunately using the direct execution context opens up to the possibility of this not happening as expected ([source](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/61792512/non-determinism-of-synchronous-execution-contexts-a-k-a-parasitic)).

The original idea still makes sense. Do you have an idea of why this would prove wrong in a benchmark?
Nope, sorry. This makes a few related changes, and this isn't the only one. If you have an idea how to profile this in isolation we can try each change in turn.
